summary: Highly motivated virologist with a focus on humoral immune responses upon viral exposure through vaccination or infection and a personal interest in vaccine development. Independently led large serological experiments and performed mouse experiments, resulting in collaborative scientific publications. Currently working in the pharmaceutical industry as subject matter expert. Activities include the development, qualification and validation of serological assays (predominantly VNAs) and life cycle management to meet the vaccine program objectives. Skilled in project management and stakeholder communication. I am an individual with a strong sense of integrity who enjoys helping others. My past performance demonstrates an ability to combine accuracy with diverse technical skill sets to bring large projects to a success.

profile_positions.description: I work as a subject matter expert on virus neutralization assays. Activities include the development, qualification and validation of assays as well as life cycle management activities in a GCLP environment, both in-house and externally at CROs.
profile_positions.title: Scientist Clinical Immunology

profile_positions.description: In the lab of Scott Hensley, I characterized antibody responses to seasonal H3N2 influenza viruses and SARS-CoV-2 in large human cohorts, using immunological assays such as ELISAs, virus neutralization assays and ELLAs. I used molecular techniques to create new viruses and recombinant proteins via reverse genetics and to quantify viral load in mouse lung tissue. I independently led and supervised a human research study and multiple large serological experiments, resulting in collaborative scientific publications.
profile_positions.title: Postdoc researcher

profile_positions.description: Development and optimization of B cell assays and Luminex assays. I independently worked on multiple research projects.

profile_positions.company: RIVM National Institute for Public Health and the Environment
profile_positions.description: Identification of immunological and virological factors contributing to the recent mumps outbreaks. I used immunological assays such as Luminex and virus neutralization assays to measure vaccine-induced antibodies. I used molecular techniques for phylogenetic analyses and to quantify viral load in human specimens. I independently worked on multiple research projects, which required extensive collaboration with other research groups.
profile_positions.title: PhD student
